ticket.title: got error on new install of 1.9.2-p136, requiring --with-baseruby
ticket.original-body:
below is the error I got when trying to run make
gcc -O3 -ggdb -Wextra -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-parentheses -Wpointer-arith -Wwrite-strings -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-long-long -I. -I.ext/include/i686-linux -I./include -I. -DRUBY_EXPORT -o enumerator.o -c enumerator.c echo executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option.; false ./tool/generic_erb.rb -c -o known_errors.inc ./template/known_errors.inc.tmpl ./defs/known_errors.def executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option. make: *** [known_errors.inc] Error 1
when I go back and add the --with-baseruby=/usr/local/ruby to the configure command and re-run the make process(make clean;make;) its getting the same error.
so I need some help, I'm stumped. Stacy
ticket.latest-body:
below is the error I got when trying to run make
gcc -O3 -ggdb -Wextra -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-parentheses -Wpointer-arith -Wwrite-strings -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-long-long -I. -I.ext/include/i686-linux -I./include -I. -DRUBY_EXPORT -o enumerator.o -c enumerator.c echo executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option.; false ./tool/generic_erb.rb -c -o known_errors.inc ./template/known_errors.inc.tmpl ./defs/known_errors.def executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option. make: *** [known_errors.inc] Error 1
when I go back and add the --with-baseruby=/usr/local/ruby to the configure command and re-run the make process(make clean;make;) its getting the same error.
so I need some help, I'm stumped. Stacy

below is the error I got when trying to run make

gcc -O3 -ggdb -Wextra -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-parentheses -Wpointer-arith -Wwrite-strings -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-long-long -I. -I.ext/include/i686-linux -I./include -I. -DRUBY_EXPORT -o enumerator.o -c enumerator.c
echo executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option.; false ./tool/generic_erb.rb -c -o known_errors.inc ./template/known_errors.inc.tmpl ./defs/known_errors.def
executable host ruby is required. use --with-baseruby option.
make: *** [known_errors.inc] Error 1

when I go back and add the --with-baseruby=/usr/local/ruby to the configure command and re-run the make process(make clean;make;) its getting the same error.

so I need some help, I'm stumped.
Stacy

version.title: got error on new install of 1.9.2-p136, requiring --with-baseruby

version.body: Problem resolved but not rubygems-1.4.2 is complaining about line 62 and path <main> not being defined.
version.body-html:
Problem resolved
but not rubygems-1.4.2 is complaining about line 62 and path not being defined.

version.body:

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
